verses.text: As snow in summer , and as rain in harvest , so honour is not seemly for a fool.
As the bird by wandering , as the swallow by flying , so the curse causeless shall not come.
A whip for the horse , a bridle for the ass , and a rod for the fool’s back. \p
Answer not a fool according to his folly , lest thou also be like unto him.
Answer a fool according to his folly , lest he be wise in his own conceit.\f + \fr 26.5 \ft conceit: Heb. eyes\f* \p
He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet , \add and\add* drinketh damage.\f + \fr 26.6 \ft damage: or, violence\f*
The legs of the lame are not equal : so \add is\add* a parable in the mouth of fools.\f + \fr 26.7 \ft are…: Heb. are lifted up\f*
As he that bindeth a stone in a sling , so \add is\add* he that giveth honour to a fool.\f + \fr 26.8 \ft bindeth…: or, putteth a precious stone in an heap of stones\f*
\add As\add* a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard , so \add is\add* a parable in the mouth of fools.

The great \add God\add* that formed all \add things\add* both rewardeth the fool , and rewardeth transgressors.\f + \fr 26.10 \ft The great…: or, A great man grieveth all, and he hireth the fool, he hireth also transgressors\f*
As a dog returneth to his vomit , \add so\add* a fool returneth to his folly.\f + \fr 26.11 \ft returneth to his folly: Heb. iterateth his folly\f*
Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit ? \add there is\add* more hope of a fool than of him.
The slothful \add man\add* saith , \add There is\add* a lion in the way ; a lion \add is\add* in the streets.
\add As\add* the door turneth upon his hinges , so \add doth\add* the slothful upon his bed.
The slothful hideth his hand in \add his\add* bosom ; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.\f + \fr 26.15 \ft it grieveth…: or, he is weary\f*
The sluggard \add is\add* wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.
He that passeth by , \add and\add* meddleth with strife \add belonging\add* not to him, \add is like\add* one that taketh a dog by the ears.\f + \fr 26.17 \ft meddleth: or, is enraged\f* \p
As a mad \add man\add* who casteth firebrands , arrows , and death ,\f + \fr 26.18 \ft firebrands: Heb. flames, or, sparks\f*
So \add is\add* the man \add that\add* deceiveth his neighbour , and saith , Am not I in sport ? \p

Where no wood is, \add there\add* the fire goeth out : so where \add there is\add* no talebearer , the strife ceaseth.\f + \fr 26.20 \ft Where no…: Heb. Without wood\f*\f + \fr 26.20 \ft talebearer: or, whisperer\f*\f + \fr 26.20 \ft ceaseth: Heb. is silent\f*
\add As\add* coals \add are\add* to burning coals , and wood to fire ; so \add is\add* a contentious man to kindle strife.
The words of a talebearer \add are\add* as wounds , and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.\f + \fr 26.22 \ft innermost…: Heb. chambers\f*
Burning lips and a wicked heart \add are like\add* a potsherd covered with silver dross. \p
He that hateth dissembleth with his lips , and layeth up deceit within him;\f + \fr 26.24 \ft dissembleth: or, is known\f*
When he speaketh fair , believe him not: for \add there are\add* seven abominations in his heart.\f + \fr 26.25 \ft speaketh…: Heb. maketh his voice gracious\f*
\add Whose\add* hatred is covered by deceit , his wickedness shall be shewed before the \add whole\add* congregation.\f + \fr 26.26 \ft by…: or, in secret\f*
Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone , it will return upon him.
A lying tongue hateth \add those that are\add* afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
